response_parsed.title: Benchmarking Batch Jobs Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to utilize FastAPI and Python 3.12+'s built-in benchmarking tools to measure the performance of batch jobs.
key_points: Install necessary dependencies, including FastAPI, Uvicorn, and a profiling library like cProfile or line_profiler.
Create a FastAPI application with endpoint(s) for your batch job(s).
Decorate the function(s) handling your batch jobs with @profile or equivalent profiler decorator.
Run your FastAPI server using Uvicorn, then test and benchmark your batch jobs by repeatedly calling the endpoints.
View profiling results in various formats (e.g., text, HTML, JSON) to analyze performance and identify bottlenecks.
version_notes: Python 3.12+'s built-in profiler can be used with FastAPI to benchmark batch jobs.
This example uses the @profile decorator for cProfile, but you could also use line_profiler or other profiling libraries.
caveats: Ensure that your test environment is free of external factors affecting performance (e.g., memory limits, network latency).
When running on a production server, consider using dedicated benchmarking tools designed for the server environment.
Keep in mind that profiling may impact the performance of your batch jobs during testing.
